data.text: @ScoopskiTheBand I wasn't fasting. Just the idea of having had a treat that day mentally stopped me from "whoa is me gonna blow it real good" from anxiety.  Instead it was, I had a cookie before my walk this afternoon.  Life's good.

@KDatzkiw Awesome! Intermittent fasting helps me a lot. I find if I only eat everything between 3-8 pm, I lose weight really well and it keeps me disciplined... it's just having the willpower to get back into the groove of it.
@ScoopskiTheBand I found having a small treat between noon - 2 pm helped from a mental perspective. It ended the 10 pm bag of Doritos and litre of chocolate milk.
@ScoopskiTheBand Totally my friend. You are by no means alone there.
@Kiffie8 Totally. I take full accountability, but the lockdown certainly did a number on my mental health, sadly.. and I know I'm not alone in that by any stretch.
@ScoopskiTheBand An important post my friend. It's another 'unforeseen' consequence.

@TimothyJudsonT Awesome! I tried keto before and it definitely works, was hard to stick with but it pays off. I'm doing a kind of a variation now, lo-carb but a little less strict and it's working so far.
@ScoopskiTheBand keto diet helped me shed 55 pounds and keep it off, and cut my Janumet in half, as well as eliminate a night dose of glimeperide. Packed on a bunch of muscle too.

@saramccolligan Thank you! Yeah I've had issues with food since I was young. I was 400 lbs by 19 years old. Over the course of a year, I lost about 180 lbs, and since then never crossed 300 again luckily (came close though).

I wish you the best in your battles as well! 🙏
